definitions: To decide that something arranged will not happen or take place.
To stop a service or an agreement.
To remove a stamp or ticket so that it cannot be used again.
To remove something that has been written or printed, especially a word or words.
To have the effect of making something else seem unimportant or not to exist.
examples: The flight was canceled due to bad weather.
I want to cancel my subscription.
The post office canceled the stamps.
Please cancel the last two words.
His apology did not cancel out the hurt.
